articles.title: Ofcom investigates Elon Musk's X over Grok AI sexual deepfakes

Предполагается, что искусственный интеллект генерировал интимные снимки без согласия участников. Ofcom проверяет, нарушены ли нормы онлайн-безопасности и защиты пользователей.

Власти стран выразили озабоченность по поводу этических рисков и нарушения частной жизни.

По её утверждению, вскоре после обращения она была уволена, что она расценивает как репрессалии. Дело рассматривается в суде.

articles.title: Controversial US study on hepatitis B vaccines in Africa is cancelled
articles.summary:
$1.6m project drew outrage over ethical questions about withholding vaccines proven to prevent disease

The controversial US-funded study on hepatitis B vaccines among newborns in Guinea-Bissau has been halted, according to Yap Boum, a senior official at the Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

“The study has been cancelled,” Boum told journalists at a press conference on Thursday morning.

articles.title: Social media time does not increase teenagers’ mental health problems – study
articles.summary: Крупное исследование показало, что время, проводимое подростками в соцсетях и за видеоиграми, не является причиной возникновения симптомов тревоги или депрессии. Ученые не нашли доказательств того, что более тяжелое использование цифровых устройств усугубляет проблемы с ментальным здоровьем. Эти результаты могут повлиять на дискуссию о возможном запрете соцсетей для лиц младше 16 лет.

articles.summary:
Soaking fabrics in a commonly used insect repellent is a simple and effective tool as mosquito bites become more common during daytime, study shows

From Africa to Latin America to Asia, babies have been carried in cloth wraps on their mothers’ backs for centuries. Now, the practice of generations of women could become a lifesaving tool in the fight against malaria.

articles.title: Pesticides may drastically shorten fish lifespans, study finds
articles.summary:
Even low levels of widely used agricultural chemicals were linked to accelerated ageing, research suggests

The lifespan of fish appears to be drastically reduced by pesticides, a study has found.

Even low levels of common agricultural pesticides can stunt the long-term lifespan of fish, according to research led by Jason Rohr, a biologist at the University of Notre Dame in Indiana.

articles.title: Horses can smell fear in humans, researchers say
articles.summary:
Tests showed horses that smelled body odour from people watching scary films startled more easily

Horses can smell fear, or at least whether you have scared yourself witless watching a horror movie, according to researchers who say the effect has consequences for riders, trainers and others who work with the animals.

In a series of tests, horses that smelled body odour from people watching scary films startled more easily, had higher heart rates and approached their handlers less

articles.original_description:

Jillian Ambrose, the Guardian energy correspondent, explains to Ian Sample the appeal of Venezuelan oil to the US, how easy it is to extract and what the latest action tells us about Trump’s energy strategy

articles.title: The man taking over the Large Hadron Collider – only to switch it off
articles.summary: Марк Томпсон, профессор Кембриджского университета, становится новым генеральным директором CERN. Он возглавит организацию с целью построения нового, более мощного коллайдера для замены Большого адронного коллайдера. Это решение означает, что при его участии старый коллайдер будет выключен ради исследований более глубоких тайн вселенной.
articles.original_description:
Next head of Cern backs massive replacement for world’s largest machine to investigate mysteries of the universe

Mark Thomson, a professor of experimental particle physics at the University of Cambridge, has landed one of the most coveted jobs in global science. But it is hard not to wonder, when looked at from a certain angle, whether he has taken one for the team.

articles.title: NASA brings Crew-11 home early in rare medical evacuation
articles.summary: SpaceX Crew-11 splashed down safely in the Pacific after more than five months in orbit aboard the International Space Station. The four astronauts completed over 140 experiments and traveled nearly 71 million miles around Earth. NASA brought the crew home earlier than planned due to a medical concern, with officials confirming the affected crew member is stable. The mission underscores how quickly today’s space programs can adapt while keeping astronauts safe.

articles.title: Scientists found the soil secret that doubles forest regrowth
articles.summary: New research shows tropical forests can recover twice as fast after deforestation when their soils contain enough nitrogen. Scientists followed forest regrowth across Central America for decades and found that nitrogen plays a decisive role in how quickly trees return. Faster regrowth also means more carbon captured from the atmosphere. The study points to smarter reforestation strategies that work with nature rather than relying on fertilizers.

articles.title: Stretchable OLED displays take a big leap forward
articles.summary: Учёные создали новый OLED-дизайн, способный значительно растягиваться, не теряя яркости, благодаря комбинации эффективных светоизлучающих материалов и прозрачных электродов на основе MXene. Технология прошла испытания, подтвердившие сохранение яркости даже после многократного растяжения. Это открывает перспективы для создания гибких экранов для носимых устройств и датчиков здоровья.
articles.original_description: A new OLED design can stretch dramatically while staying bright, solving a problem that has long limited flexible displays. The breakthrough comes from pairing a highly efficient light-emitting material with tough, transparent MXene-based electrodes. Tests showed the display kept most of its brightness even after repeated stretching. The technology could power future wearable screens and on-skin health sensors.

articles.title: Fewer offspring, longer life: The hidden rule of mammal aging
articles.summary: A large international study reveals that mammals tend to live longer when reproduction is suppressed. On average, lifespan increases by about 10 percent, though the reasons differ for males and females. Castrated males avoid the harmful effects of testosterone, while females gain longevity by sidestepping the intense physical demands of pregnancy and nursing. The results underscore a powerful biological trade-off between making offspring and staying alive longer.

articles.title: Statins may help almost everyone with type 2 diabetes live longer
articles.summary: New research suggests statins may protect adults with type 2 diabetes regardless of how low their predicted heart risk appears. In a large UK study, statin use was linked to fewer deaths and major cardiac events across all risk levels. Even those labeled “low risk” benefited, challenging long-held assumptions about who should receive preventive therapy. Side effects were rare and generally mild.

articles.title: One protein may decide whether brain chemistry heals or harms
articles.summary: Белок триптофан, критически важный для регуляции настроения и энергии, с возрастом или при неврологических заболеваниях может перенаправляться к вредным продуктам обмена. Это нарушение вызывает негативные последствия, включая ухудшение памяти, проблемы со сном и эмоциональную нестабильность. Ученые изучают механизмы этого процесса для поиска новых терапевтических стратегий.
articles.original_description: Tryptophan does far more than help us sleep—it fuels brain chemistry, energy production, and mood-regulating neurotransmitters. But as the brain ages or develops neurological disease, this delicate system goes awry, pushing tryptophan toward harmful byproducts linked to memory loss, mood changes, and sleep problems.

articles.title: Vitamin A may be helping cancer hide from the immune system
articles.summary: A vitamin A byproduct has been found to quietly disarm the immune system, allowing tumors to evade attack and weakening cancer vaccines. Scientists have now developed a drug that shuts down this pathway, dramatically boosting immune responses and slowing cancer growth in preclinical studies.
articles.original_description: A vitamin A byproduct has been found to quietly disarm the immune system, allowing tumors to evade attack and weakening cancer vaccines. articles.title: Scientists “resurrect” ancient cannabis enzymes with medical promise
articles.summary: Scientists have uncovered how cannabis evolved the ability to make its most famous compounds—THC, CBD, and CBC—by recreating ancient enzymes that existed millions of years ago. These early enzymes were multitaskers, capable of producing several cannabinoids at once, before evolution fine-tuned them into today’s highly specialized forms. By “resurrecting” these long-lost enzymes in the lab, researchers showed how cannabis chemistry became more precise over time—and discovered something unexpected

articles.title: A deadly chemical frozen in ice may have sparked life on Earth
articles.summary: Hydrogen cyanide, a toxic chemical, may have helped spark the chemistry that led to life. When frozen, it forms crystals with highly reactive surfaces that can drive unusual chemical reactions, even in extreme cold. These reactions could produce more reactive molecules that pave the way for life’s basic ingredients. The findings suggest frozen worlds may be more chemically active than once thought.

articles.title: Those strange red dots in James Webb images finally have an explanation
articles.summary: For years, strange red dots in James Webb images left scientists puzzled. New research shows they are young black holes hidden inside dense clouds of gas, glowing as they devour their surroundings. These black holes are smaller than expected but grow rapidly, shedding light on how supermassive black holes appeared so early in cosmic history. The finding reveals a violent and messy phase of the universe’s youth.

articles.title: Electrons stop acting like particles—and physics still works
articles.summary: Physicists have long relied on the idea that electrons behave like tiny particles zipping through materials, even though quantum physics says their exact position is fundamentally uncertain. Now, researchers at TU Wien have discovered something surprising: a material where this particle picture completely breaks down can still host exotic topological states—features once thought to depend on particle-like behavior.

articles.title: This after-meal blood sugar spike may raise Alzheimer’s risk
articles.summary: Spikes in blood sugar after eating may be more dangerous for the brain than previously thought. In a massive genetic study, people with higher post-meal blood sugar had a much greater risk of Alzheimer’s disease. The effect couldn’t be explained by visible brain damage, suggesting hidden biological pathways may be involved. Researchers say managing blood sugar after meals could become a key strategy for reducing dementia risk.

articles.title: Forest loss is driving mosquitoes’ thirst for human blood
articles.summary: In the rapidly disappearing Atlantic Forest, mosquitoes are adapting to a human-dominated landscape. Scientists found that many species now prefer feeding on people rather than the forest’s diverse wildlife. This behavior dramatically raises the risk of spreading dangerous viruses such as dengue and Zika. The findings reveal how deforestation can quietly reshape disease dynamics.

articles.title: Scientists question the safety of BPA-free packaging
articles.summary: “BPA-free” food packaging may be hiding new risks. A McGill University study found that several BPA substitutes used in grocery price labels can seep into food and interfere with vital processes in human ovarian cells. Some triggered unusual fat buildup and disrupted genes linked to cell repair and growth. The results raise concerns that BPA replacements may be just as troubling as the chemical they replaced.

articles.title: Northwestern Medicine’s new antibody wakes the immune system against pancreatic cancer
articles.summary: Pancreatic cancer uses a sugar-coated disguise to evade the immune system, helping explain why it’s so hard to treat. Northwestern scientists discovered this hidden mechanism and created an antibody that strips away the tumor’s protective signal. In animal tests, immune cells sprang back into action and tumors grew much more slowly. The team is now refining the therapy for future human trials.

articles.title: Scientists uncover a hidden type of diabetes in newborns
articles.summary: Researchers have discovered a rare new type of diabetes that affects babies early in life. The condition is caused by changes in a single gene that prevent insulin-producing cells from working properly. When these cells fail, blood sugar rises and diabetes develops, often alongside neurological problems. The findings help explain a long-standing medical mystery and deepen understanding of diabetes overall.

articles.title: Scientists finally uncover why statins cause muscle pain
articles.summary: Ученые выяснили, что мышечная боль от статинов возникает из-за их связывания с белком мышц, что вызывает утечку кальция внутри клеток. Этот процесс либо напрямую ослабляет мышцы, либо запускает их разрушение. Новое открытие объясняет причину побочных эффектов, из-за которых многие пациенты прекращают лечение.
articles.original_description: A new discovery may explain why so many people abandon cholesterol-lowering statins because of muscle pain and weakness. Researchers found that certain statins can latch onto a key muscle protein and trigger a tiny but harmful calcium leak inside muscle cells. That leak may weaken muscles directly or activate processes that slowly break them down, offering a long-sought explanation for statin-related aches.

articles.title: A 3,000-year high: Alaska’s Arctic is entering a dangerous new fire era
articles.summary: For thousands of years, wildfires on Alaska’s North Slope were rare. That changed sharply in the 20th century, when warming temperatures dried soils and fueled the spread of shrubs, setting the stage for intense fires. Peat cores and satellite data reveal that fire activity since the 1950s has reached record levels. The findings suggest the Arctic is entering a new, more dangerous fire era.

articles.title: “Marine darkwaves”: Hidden ocean blackouts are putting sealife at risk
articles.summary: Scientists have identified a newly recognized threat lurking beneath the ocean’s surface: sudden episodes of underwater darkness that can last days or even months. Caused by storms, sediment runoff, algae blooms, and murky water, these “marine darkwaves” dramatically reduce light reaching the seafloor, putting kelp forests, seagrass, and other light-dependent life at risk.

articles.title: New research challenges the cold dark matter assumption
articles.summary: Dark matter, one of the Universe’s greatest mysteries, may have been born blazing hot instead of cold and sluggish as scientists long believed. New research shows that dark matter particles could have been moving near the speed of light shortly after the Big Bang, only to cool down later and still help form galaxies. articles.title: How Chevron played the long game in Venezuela

Благодаря этому она смогла возобновить добычу и транспортировку нефти, получив выгоды от ослабления конкурентов и смягчения Вашингтоном ограничений.

articles.title: The Miccosukee Tribe blocked Alligator Alcatraz. Then Trump blocked a bill to return their land.
articles.summary: Племя Миккосуки выступило против проекта «Аллигатор Алькатрас», после чего администрация Трампа заблокировала законопроект о возврате земель племени.

articles.title: Trump just took his most dramatic step yet against global climate action
articles.summary: Президент США Дональд Трамп инициировал процедуру выхода страны из Парижского климатического соглашения. Этот шаг стал наиболее радикальным действием администрации в направлении свертывания глобальной политики по борьбе с изменением климата. США являются второй по величине экономикой мира, что может серьезно подорвать эффективность международных договоренностей.

articles.title: In 2025, the US suffered a billion-dollar disaster every 10 days
articles.summary: В 2025 году США ежедекадно постигал катастрофический ущерб, исчисляемый миллиардами долларов. По данным Национального управления океанических и атмосферных исследований, число таких стихийных бедствий возросло по сравнению с прошлыми годами. Учащение экстремальных явлений связывают с изменением климата.

articles.title: Trump invaded Venezuela to restore an oil industry he helped destroy
articles.summary: Президент Трамп оправдывает военное вторжение в Венесуэлу необходимостью восстановить нефтяную отрасль страны. При этом отмечается, что эта отрасль ранее была разрушена из-за введенных США санкций и внешнеполитических действий самого Трампа.

articles.title: Texas clears the way for petrochemical expansion as experts warn of health risks
articles.summary: Власти Техаса одобряют расширение нефтехимической промышленности, несмотря на предупреждения экспертов о рисках для здоровья. Решение может привести к увеличению выбросов вредных веществ в регионах, где уже зафиксированы проблемы с качеством воздуха.

articles.title: Why forcing people to go green can backfire
articles.summary: Принуждение к экологичному поведению может вызвать реактивное сопротивление, когда люди отстаивают свою свободу выбора. Это приводит к обратному эффекту, снижая мотивацию к экологическим действиям и сводя на нет усилия по охране окружающей среды.

articles.title: Trump says he’ll unleash Venezuela’s oil. But who wants it?
articles.summary: Трамп пообещал возобновить покупку венесуэльской нефти, отменяя санкции Байдена. Однако спрос на нее остается низким из-за устаревшей инфраструктуры, высоких закупочных рисков и конкуренции со стороны других поставщиков.

articles.title: Iran’s Regime Has Survived War, Sanctions and Uprising. Environmental Crises May Bring It Down.
articles.summary: Иранский режим, переживший войны, санкции и восстания, теперь столкнулся с новой угрозой — экологическим кризисом. Десятилетия пренебрежения научными рекомендациями, преследование активистов и коррумпированные проекты в сочетании с экономическими проблемами и политическим гнетом усилили недовольство общества. Экологическая катастрофа может стать тем фактором, который окончательно подорвет стабильность режима.
articles.original_description: The anti‑government protests sweeping across Iran, from major cities to rural towns, are fueled by anger over economic collapse and political repression. But beneath the headlines of currency devaluations and street clashes lies a deeper, more permanent driver of dissent: ecological calamity. articles.title: Revolutionary eye injection saved my sight, says first-ever patient
articles.summary: Пациентка Никки стала первой, кому удалось сохранить зрение благодаря новой методике введения геля в глаз. Ее глазное яблоко было частично разрушено, но инъекция помогла восстановить структуру и функцию глаза. Лечение стало прорывом в офтальмологии и может изменить подход к терапии подобных заболеваний.
articles.original_description: Nicki's eye had collapsed in on itself, but a new gel injection method has saved her vision.

articles.title: I spent months trying to find out if boosting my gut health could help me age better

articles.original_description: Health editor Hugh Pym revamped his diet after a test suggested his gut health appeared to look five years older than he was

articles.title: Why the NHS still wastes billions on patients who don't need to be in hospital
articles.summary: В британской системе здравоохранения (NHS) ежегодно тратятся миллиарды фунтов на пациентов, которые уже не нуждаются в стационарном лечении, но остаются в больницах из-за задержек с выпиской. Эта проблема выявляет системные недостатки в координации ухода и ставит вопрос о чрезмерном лечении отдельных пациентов.
articles.original_description: The delayed discharge challenge throws up deeper questions about the care system, co-ordination - and whether some patients are over-treated

articles.title: Eye surgeon's advice after his own sight-saving op
articles.summary: Офтальмолог Эмир Хамид, которому была экстренно оказана помощь при отслойке сетчатки, призывает людей не игнорировать симптомы этого опасного заболевания. Он подчеркивает, что сохранить зрение ему удалось только благодаря быстрому обращению к врачу.
articles.original_description: Dr Amir Hamid said his sight was saved by quick treatment when he had symptoms of a detached retina.

articles.title: People who come off slimming jabs regain weight four times faster than dieters
articles.summary: Люди, прекратившие использование препаратов для похудения, набирают вес в четыре раза быстрее, чем те, кто сбрасывал вес традиционными методами. Согласно исследованию, после отмены инъекций такие пациенты в среднем набирают 0,8 кг в месяц.
articles.original_description: Overweight people shed large amounts on jabs but gain 0.8 kg a month on average once off them, study shows.

articles.title: Flu on the rise again after Christmas mixing, says NHS
articles.summary: Количество случаев гриппа в Великобритании снова растёт после двухнедельного снижения, что связывают с активным общением населения после Рождества. Одновременно в больницах отмечают рост числа травм из-за скользких дорог и погодных условий во время похолодания.
articles.original_description: Cases up after two weeks of decline, as hospitals report rise in slips and falls because of cold snap.

articles.title: Doctors strike called off as union backs latest pay deal

Медики, которые должны были провести первую в истории национальную акцию протеста работников Национальной службы здравоохранения (NHS), приостановили действия в связи с достигнутым соглашением.
articles.original_description: Medics had been set to go on the first national walkout staged by NHS workers on Tuesday in a dispute over pay.

articles.title: Long waits for disability benefit claims unacceptable, MPs say

articles.original_description: Some people are waiting more than a year to have their claims processed, the Public Accounts Committee says.

articles.title: Three NHS trusts still using fax machines, Streeting confesses

articles.original_description: The health secretary had made it his personal mission to banish the fax machine from the NHS.

articles.title: China’s ‘Dr. Frankenstein’ Thinks Time Is on His Side

articles.original_description: He Jiankui spent three years in prison after creating gene-edited babies. Now back at work, he sees a greater opening for researchers who push boundaries.

articles.title: David Mitchell, Who Led Fight on Drug Prices, Dies at 75
articles.summary: Дэвид Митчелл, боровшийся с ростом цен на лекарства, скончался в возрасте 75 лет. После диагноза неизлечимого рака он использовал свой опыт в сфере связей с общественностью, чтобы привлечь внимание к проблеме высокой стоимости медикаментов.
articles.original_description: After receiving a diagnosis of terminal cancer, he used his experience in public relations to draw attention to the skyrocketing cost of medication.

articles.title: E.P.A. to Stop Considering Lives Saved by Limiting Air Pollution
articles.summary: Агентство по охране окружающей среды США (E.P.A.) отказалось от учёта экономической ценности спасённых жизней при установлении норм загрязнения воздуха. Теперь при расчёте экологических стандартов будут учитываться только затраты для промышленности. Решение основано на внутренних документах ведомства.
articles.original_description: In a reversal, the agency plans to calculate only the cost to industry when setting pollution limits, and not the monetary value of saving human lives, documents show.

articles.title: Jirdes Winther Baxter, 101, Dies; Last Survivor of Epidemic in Alaska
articles.summary: Скончалась Джирдес Винтр Бакстер, последняя выжившая из эпидемии дифтерии в Номе, Аляска. Её спасение стало возможным благодаря знаменитому собачьему перегоночному пробегу протяжённостью почти 700 миль, доставившему жизненно важную сыворотку.
articles.original_description: An outbreak of diphtheria inspired a celebrated sled dog relay of nearly 700 miles to deliver lifesaving serum to the remote town of Nome.

articles.title: New Children’s Vaccine Schedule May Not Be the Last of RFK Jr.’s Big Changes

Предлагаемые изменения вызывают дискуссии о балансе между личной свободой и общественным здоровьем.

Hamnet and H Is for Hawk fuse themes of loss, birds and elemental female emotion. But whose fault is it if you remain dry-eyed?

articles.title: Digested week: Despite the Golden Globes being a joke, the audience keep turning up
articles.summary: Несмотря на расформирование Голливудской ассоциации иностранной прессы (HFPA) из-за скандалов, церемония «Золотого глобуса» продолжает привлекать зрителей. Автор отмечает, что, несмотря на шутки о сомнительной репутации премии, аудитория не перестает ее смотреть.
articles.original_description:
Is there any circumstance on Earth that would make these people not sit this thing out?

The truest thing ever said about the Golden Globes was by Tina Fey when she hosted the awards in 2019 and described the Hollywood Foreign Press Association, a group of junket hacks, as operating out of the “back booth of a French McDonalds”. The HFPA was disbanded in 2023 after allegations of racism, but 95 former members retained voting rights and on Monday, the show went on.

Автор утверждает, что такой подход игнорирует сложность и противоречивость их произведений, лишая их первоначальной художественной ценности.

articles.title: John Forté, Grammy-nominated musician who worked with Fugees, dies at 50
articles.summary:
Musician, whose 14-year prison sentence was commuted by George W Bush, was found dead in his Massachusetts home

John Forté, the Grammy-nominated musician known for his work with the Fugees and the Refugee Camp All-Stars among others, has died at age 50.

He was found dead Monday afternoon in his home in Chilmark, Massachusetts, according to police.

Cont

The 24 actor was taken into custody after officers responded to a call in Hollywood shortly after midnight
